title: Eastman announces project success with USAMP, PADNOS and Yanfeng for fully circular recycling study in automotive ... - PR Newswire
summary: Eastman, USAMP, PADNOS, and Yanfeng have demonstrated a closed-loop recycling project that successfully converts automotive shredder residue (ASR) into new automotive parts. This project showcases the feasibility of Eastman's carbon renewal technology (CRT) to recycle complex plastics, diverting waste from landfills and reducing greenhouse gas emissions. The recycled resins meet the requirements of major OEMs, including Ford, GM, and Stellantis, opening the door for a truly circular economy in the automotive industry.
green_innovation: TRUE. The project demonstrates a closed-loop recycling process that converts automotive shredder residue (ASR) into new automotive parts. This innovation contributes to environmental sustainability by reducing waste and greenhouse gas emissions.
business_innovation: TRUE. The project introduces a new process for recycling ASR, which is a significant improvement over traditional mechanical recycling streams. This innovation has the potential to transform the automotive industry by enabling the recycling of hard-to-recycle plastics and fibers.
green_product: TRUE. The resins produced from the recycled ASR meet the requirements of major OEMs, including Ford, GM, and Stellantis. These resins can be used to produce new automotive parts, reducing the environmental impact of vehicle production.
green_process: TRUE. Eastman's carbon renewal technology (CRT) is a green process that breaks down plastic-rich ASR into molecular building blocks. This process enables the recycling of complex plastics that would otherwise end up in landfills or be recovered through waste-to-energy technologies.
likely_naics_codes: ['325211: Plastics Materials and Resins Manufacturing', '336399: All Other Motor Vehicle Parts Manufacturing', '562111: Solid Waste Collection', '562920: Materials Recovery Facilities']
greenwashing: FALSE. The project is not an example of greenwashing as it demonstrates a genuine innovation in the recycling of automotive plastics.

title: Why Earth Day 2023 Is A Big Deal For Brands And Consumers In China - Jing Daily
summary: An increasing number of companies are using the Earth Day holiday to tout their commitment to green practices as local Chinese consumers prioritize sustainability. Some brands, like Prada, are investing in a vertical integration model to attain complete control and traceability of their supply chain while avoiding the accusations of greenwashing. Other companies are introducing new products such as limited edition recycled skater clothing capsule collections, or product impact labeling systems that grade the polution levels during the supply chain process on a scale, allowing consumers to track the product’s environmental and social impact.
green_innovation: TRUE: Chinese consumers are becoming increasingly environmentally conscious. Brands are showcasing new green initiatives and products on Earth Day to demonstrate their commitment to sustainability.
business_innovation: TRUE: Companies such as Prada are investing in new business models such as vertical integration to attain complete control and traceability of their supply chains.
green_product: TRUE: Li-Ning released a limited-edition recycled skater clothing capsule collection in collaboration with Steve Harrington.
green_process: TRUE: French beauty house Biotherm developed a product impact labeling system, which grades a product’s pollution levels during the supply chain process.
product_or_process: limited-edition recycled skater clothing capsule collection
likely_naics_codes: ["315220 Women's and Girls' Cut and Sew Apparel Manufacturing", '315999 Other Apparel Accessories and Other Apparel Manufacturing', '423940 Sporting and Recreational Goods and Supplies Merchant Wholesalers', '448190 Other Clothing Stores']

title: L'Oréal and Alibaba join hands in sustainable packaging campaign - Dao Insights
summary: L'Oréal and Alibaba have teamed up to make China's beauty industry more sustainable by establishing green and low-carbon standards, developing new products, and creating measurable circular economy solutions.  The partnership includes improving product packaging to comply with L'Oréal's "3R" principles of reduce, reuse, and recycle, with a goal of having 100% of the plastic used in packaging come from recycled or bio-based resources by 2030. The two companies are also launching the "88 Carbon Reduction Day" campaign to encourage consumers to reduce their carbon footprint through reduced, reusable, and recyclable low-carbon product choices.
green_innovation: TRUE, the partnership between L'Oréal and Alibaba aims to establish green and low-carbon standards, develop new products, and create measurable circular economy solutions for China's beauty industry.
business_innovation: TRUE, the partnership between L'Oréal and Alibaba includes improving product packaging to comply with L'Oréal's "3R" principles of reduce, reuse, and recycle.
green_product: TRUE, L'Oréal aims to have 100% of the plastic used in packaging come from recycled or bio-based resources by 2030.
green_process: TRUE, the partnership between L'Oréal and Alibaba includes creating measurable circular economy solutions for China's beauty industry.
product_or_process: sustainable beauty industry solutions in China

title: L'Oréal And Alibaba To Tackle Beauty's Environmental Problem In China - Jing Daily
summary: L'Oréal and Alibaba have partnered to improve the sustainability of China’s beauty industry by setting low-carbon standards, creating circular economy solutions, and educating consumers on sustainable lifestyles. The initiative focuses on reducing the environmental impact of the beauty sector's supply chain, which includes warehousing, packaging, distribution, and recycling. This partnership aims to address the industry's significant waste problem, estimated at 120 billion units of packaging annually, most of which is not recyclable.

title: CS Tuiya invites Danish waste recyclers to invest in Kenya - The Star Kenya
summary: Environment CS Soipan Tuiya has invited Danish waste recycling companies to invest in Kenya's emerging circular economy. She said the country has established a robust regulatory framework to anchor the sector, assuring them of government's support. She spoke on Thursday during the official opening of the 2023 Loop Forum in Copenhagen, Denmark, where she delivered the key note address at the invitation of the Danish Government.
green_innovation: TRUE, The article describes an emerging circular economy in Kenya.
business_innovation: FALSE, The article does not describe a specific business innovation other than in general terms.
green_product: FALSE, The article does not describe a specific green product.
green_process: FALSE, The article does not describe a specific green process.
